#### Assumptions for a Linear Model:

-   Linearity: Residual vs Fitted; no pattern

-   Independence of Residuals: Read study design

-   Homoscedasticity: Scale-Location graph, we expect a horizontal line

-   Normality of Residuals: QQ plot is linear

Based on the description of the data we have no reason to suspect a dependency\
between the observations, but we do not have enough information to be sure that\
the observations are independent. The diagnostic plots donâ€™t point to a clear\
violation of the assumptions. The residuals appear approximately normal on a QQ\
plot, and neither the residual plot nor the scale-location plot show any clear trend.
